verses.kjv: And I saw an angel come down from heaven, having the key of the bottomless pit and a great chain in his hand.
verses.ct: Then I saw an angel coming down from heaven, holding the key to the bottomless pit and a massive chain in his hand.

verses.kjv: And he laid hold on the dragon, that old serpent, which is the Devil, and Satan, and bound him a thousand years,
verses.ct: He seized the dragon — that ancient serpent, who is the Devil and Satan — and chained him up for 1,000 years.

verses.kjv: And cast him into the bottomless pit, and shut him up, and set a seal upon him, that he should deceive the nations no more, till the thousand years should be fulfilled: and after that he must be loosed a little season.
verses.ct: The angel threw him into the bottomless pit, locked it, and sealed it over him so that he could no longer deceive the nations until the 1,000 years were complete. After that, he must be released for a short time.

verses.kjv: And I saw thrones, and they sat upon them, and judgment was given unto them: and I saw the souls of them that were beheaded for the witness of Jesus, and for the word of God, and which had not worshipped the beast, neither his image, neither had received his mark upon their foreheads, or in their hands; and they lived and reigned with Christ a thousand years.
verses.ct: Then I saw thrones with people seated on them who had been given authority to judge. I also saw the souls of those who had been executed for their testimony about Jesus and for the word of God — those who had refused to worship the beast or its image and had not accepted its mark on their foreheads or hands. They came to life and ruled with Christ for 1,000 years.

verses.kjv: But the rest of the dead lived not again until the thousand years were finished. This is the first resurrection.
verses.ct: The remaining dead did not come back to life until the 1,000 years were over. This is the first resurrection.

verses.kjv: Blessed and holy is he that hath part in the first resurrection: on such the second death hath no power, but they shall be priests of God and of Christ, and shall reign with him a thousand years.
verses.ct: Anyone who takes part in the first resurrection is blessed and holy. The second death holds no power over them. They will serve as priests of God and of Christ and will rule with him for 1,000 years.

verses.kjv: And when the thousand years are expired, Satan shall be loosed out of his prison,
verses.ct: When the 1,000 years come to an end, Satan will be released from his prison.

verses.kjv: And shall go out to deceive the nations which are in the four quarters of the earth, Gog and Magog, to gather them together to battle: the number of whom is as the sand of the sea.
verses.ct: He will go out to deceive the nations across the 4 corners of the earth — Gog and Magog — rallying them for war. Their number will be like the sand on the seashore.

verses.kjv: And they went up on the breadth of the earth, and compassed the camp of the saints about, and the beloved city: and fire came down from God out of heaven, and devoured them.
verses.ct: They marched across the whole surface of the earth and surrounded the camp of God's people and the beloved city. But fire came down from God out of heaven and consumed them.

verses.kjv: And the devil that deceived them was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone, where the beast and the false prophet are, and shall be tormented day and night for ever and ever.
verses.ct: The devil who had deceived them was thrown into the lake of fire and sulfur, where the beast and the false prophet already were. They will be tormented day and night forever and ever.

verses.kjv: And I saw a great white throne, and him that sat on it, from whose face the earth and the heaven fled away; and there was found no place for them.
verses.ct: Then I saw a great white throne and the one sitting on it. Earth and heaven fled from his presence, and no place was found for them.

verses.kjv: And I saw the dead, small and great, stand before God; and the books were opened: and another book was opened, which is the book of life: and the dead were judged out of those things which were written in the books, according to their works.
verses.ct: I saw the dead — both ordinary and powerful — standing in front of God. Books were opened, and then another book was opened, which is the book of life. The dead were judged based on what was recorded in the books, according to what they had done.

verses.kjv: And the sea gave up the dead which were in it; and death and hell delivered up the dead which were in them: and they were judged every man according to their works.
verses.ct: The sea surrendered the dead that were in it, and death and the grave gave up the dead that were in them. Each person was judged according to what they had done.

verses.kjv: And death and hell were cast into the lake of fire. This is the second death.
verses.ct: Then death and the grave were thrown into the lake of fire. This is the second death.

verses.kjv: And whosoever was not found written in the book of life was cast into the lake of fire.
verses.ct: Whoever was not found recorded in the book of life was thrown into the lake of fire.
